p:
Chenopodium oahuense survival probability was inversely related to soil moisture and elevation, with approximately four times greater probability of survival in locations with low soil moisture and elevation respectively ( Table 4; Table in S2 Table). Survival increased slightly with temperature range for all seedlings, and 163% for seedlings of low elevation origin (w
i = 0.31). The random effect of plot explained a large proportion of model variation (ICC = 0.459).
